SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am32
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am32.client

Class View

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am32.client.View
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraphicalUI, TextUI
public abstract class View extends Object
The View class is an abstract class that serves as a template for the views of the client. It contains common properties and methods that all views should have.

The class provides abstract methods which are implemented by the concrete views. These methods are used to display the game state to the player, and to request input from the player. The class also provides methods for updating the game state and the player's information.

The class also provides methods for setting socket client and RMI client, and for notifying the ask listener.

    • setSocketClient

      public void setSocketClient(String serverIP, int port) throws ConnectionSetupFailedException
      This method is used to set up a socket client with the specified server IP and port. Also, it creates a new thread to listen for messages from the client.
      Parameters:
      serverIP - The IP address of the server.
      port - The port number of the server.
      Throws:
      ConnectionSetupFailedException - if the connection setup fails.

      Throws:

    • updateConfirmStarterCard

      public abstract void updateConfirmStarterCard(int colour, int cardID, boolean isUp, ArrayList<int[]> availablePos, int[] resources)
      This abstract method is used to place the starter card on the field, update the information of the player's field after placing the starter card, and set the player's colour.
      Parameters:
      colour - The colour of the player selected randomly by the server.
      cardID - The ID of the starter card.
      isUp - The side of the starter card selected by the player.
      availablePos - The available positions after placing the starter card.
      resources - The resources of the player after placing the starter card.

    • updatePlayerData

      public abstract void updatePlayerData(ArrayList<String> playerNicknames, ArrayList<Boolean> playerConnected, ArrayList<Integer> playerColours, ArrayList<Integer> playerHand, int playerSecretObjective, int[] playerPoints, ArrayList<ArrayList<int[]>> playerFields, int[] playerResources, ArrayList<Integer> gameCommonObjectives, ArrayList<Integer> gameCurrentResourceCards, ArrayList<Integer> gameCurrentGoldCards, int gameResourcesDeckSize, int gameGoldDeckSize, int matchStatus, ArrayList<String[]> chatHistory, String currentPlayer, ArrayList<int[]> newAvailableFieldSpaces, int resourceCardDeckFacingKingdom, int goldCardDeckFacingKingdom, ArrayList<int[]> playersResourcesSummary, ArrayList<Integer> playerAssignedSecretObjectiveCards, int playerStartingCard)
      This abstract method is used to update the player's data when the game enters the preparation phase or the player reconnects to the game.
      Parameters:
      playerNicknames - The nicknames of the players.
      playerConnected - The connection status of the players.
      playerColours - The colours of the players.
      playerHand - The cards in the player's hand.
      playerSecretObjective - The secret objective of the player.
      playerPoints - The points of the player.
      playerFields - The fields' information of the players.
      playerResources - The resources of this player.
      gameCommonObjectives - The common objectives of the game.
      gameCurrentResourceCards - The current resource cards of the game.
      gameCurrentGoldCards - The current gold cards of the game.
      gameResourcesDeckSize - The resource deck size of the game.
      gameGoldDeckSize - The gold deck size of the game.
      matchStatus - The status of the match.
      chatHistory - The chat history of the game.
      currentPlayer - The current player of the game.
      newAvailableFieldSpaces - The new available spaces on the field.
      resourceCardDeckFacingKingdom - The kingdom facing the resource card deck.
      goldCardDeckFacingKingdom - The kingdom facing the gold card deck.
      playersResourcesSummary - The resources of the players.
      playerAssignedSecretObjectiveCards - The secret objective cards assigned to the player.
      playerStartingCard - The starting card of the player.

    • updatePlacedCardConfirm

      public abstract void updatePlacedCardConfirm(String playerNickname, int placedCard, int[] placedCardCoordinates, boolean placedSide, int playerPoints, int[] playerResources, ArrayList<int[]> newAvailableFieldSpaces)
      This abstract method is used to update the field of the player when receiving a confirmation message from the server.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - The nickname of the player who placed the card.
      placedCard - The card placed by the player.
      placedCardCoordinates - The coordinates of the placed card.
      placedSide - The side of the placed card.
      playerPoints - The points of the player after placing the card.
      playerResources - The resources of the player after placing the card.
      newAvailableFieldSpaces - The new available spaces on the field after placing the card.

    • showMatchWinners

      public abstract void showMatchWinners(ArrayList<String> players, ArrayList<Integer> points, ArrayList<Integer> secrets, ArrayList<Integer> pointsGainedFromSecrets, ArrayList<String> winners)
      This abstract method is used to show the winners and the final points of the players when the match ends.
      Parameters:
      players - The players of the match.
      points - The final points of the players.
      secrets - The secret cards of the players.
      pointsGainedFromSecrets - The points gained from the objective cards.
      winners - The winners of the match.

    • updateRollback

      public abstract void updateRollback(String playerNickname, int removedCard, int playerPoints, int[] playerResources)
      This abstract method is used to remove the card from the player's field when the player is disconnected before the draw card.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - The nickname of the player who is disconnected.
      removedCard - The card removed from the player's field.
      playerPoints - The points of the player after removing the card.
      playerResources - The resources of the player after removing the card.

      chatHistory - The chat history of the player.

    • updateChat

      public abstract void updateChat(String recipientString, String senderNickname, String content)
      This abstract method is used to update the chat history when receiving a new chat message.
      Parameters:
      recipientString - The recipient of the chat message.
      senderNickname - The sender of the chat message.
      content - The content of the chat message.

    • setStarterCard

      public abstract void setStarterCard(int cardId)
      This abstract method is used to set the starter card ID.
      Parameters:
      cardId - The ID of the starter card.

    • handleEvent

      public abstract void handleEvent(Event event, String nickname)
      This abstract method is used to handle an event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event to handle.
      nickname - The nickname of the player will be used to handle the event.

    • nodeDisconnected

      public abstract void nodeDisconnected()
      Method called when the node disconnects from the game. Called from the Network to notify the View that the connection to the server is lost.

    • nodeReconnected

      public abstract void nodeReconnected()
      Method called when the node reconnects to the game. Called from the Network to notify the View that the connection to the server is restored.
